page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: THIS IS A RURAL AREA LYING ABOVE THE VALLEY OF THE RIVER AVON AND TO THE WEST OF A SMALL GROUP OF HILLS CALLED THE LENCHES.THE CLIMATE IS TEMPERATE. THE VILLAGES OF BISHAMPTON AND THROCKMORTON ARE THE TWO MAIN AREAS OF POPULATION. EACH VILLAGE HAS A CHURCH AND IS A MIXTURE OF OLD AND NEW HOUSES, THE NOW DISUSED PERSHORE AIR FIELD COVERS THE SOUTH WEST CORNER OF THE AREA.THERE IS A LITTLE WOODLAND, SOME ORCHARDS BUT MOST OF THE AREA IS USED AS PASTURE OR FOR SOWING CROPS. THERE IS NO INDUSTRIAL CONCERNS BUT QUITE A FEW PEOPLE ARE SELF-EMPLOYED. THE CHILDREN OF BOTH VILLAGES HAVE TO TRAVEL OUT OF THE AREA TO GO TO SCHOOL, AND PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS MINIMAL.
